WIDGET.name:
Welcome to Tomdroid.
Please note that this is beta quality software and that it contains known problems.
We are well aware of these issues and intend to work on them quickly but I also wanted to get something out and tested as quickly as possible.
If you would like to contribute, help at all levels would be appreciated. Hop on board on launchpad.net/tomdroid and contact us!
WIDGET.value:
Welcome to Tomdroid.
Please note that this is beta quality software and that it contains known problems.
We are well aware of these issues and intend to work on them quickly but I also wanted to get something out and tested as quickly as possible.
If you would like to contribute, help at all levels would be appreciated. Hop on board on launchpad.net/tomdroid and contact us!

WIDGET.name:
Welcome to Tomdroid!
You have no notes here yet. To get started, set your Synchronization preferences under Settings. There are two synchronization options described below.
Tomboy Web Tomboy Web is what you are looking for if you want to sync to Tomboy-Online, Ubuntu One, your own Snowy server or any server supporting the Tomboy Web REST API.
To use it, set Sync Service to Tomboy Web in preferences then provide a Server URL. Here are some of the public ones: Tomboy Online - https://edge.tomboy-online.org/ Ubuntu One - https://one.ubuntu.com/notes
Once set, hit the Sync logo on Tomdroid's top bar to synchronize your notes.
Note: you might want to back up your Tomboy notes before syncing, since this app is still under development and may corrupt your Tomboy notes. The notes can be found in ~/.local/share/tomboy/ on Linux.
SD Card Put your Tomboy notes (*.note) on your SD Card under tomdroid/. The notes can be found in ~/.local/share/tomboy/ on Linux. Once the notes are copied, set Sync Service to SD Card in preferences then hit the Sync logo on Tomdroid's top bar.
See http://live.gnome.org/Tomboy/Directories for the notes' location on other platforms.
Also, Tomdroid is always looking for new contributors. If you are interested join the tomdroid-dev team on launchpad: http://launchpad.net/~tomdroid-dev.
Lastly, if you encounter any issue, please report it at: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tomdroid

WIDGET.name:
Tomboy compatible wikiwiki note-taking application that can take notes.
Author: Olivier Bilodeau Version: 0.7.1 Licensed under the GPLv3
